==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=打酱油|type=12|lit=to buy soy sauce; to fill up the soy sauce bottle in one's household}}
{{wikipedia|lang=zh}}

===Etymology===
Popular Internet [[meme]] popularised in 2008 by a man-on-the-street's response to a television reporter's question about a recent celebrity photo scandal, to which the man replied, "What's it got to do with me? I'm here to buy soy sauce."

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=dǎjiàngyóu
|c=daa2 zoeng3 jau4
|cat=v
}}

===Verb===
{{zh-verb}}

# {{lb|zh|slang}} to be [[none of someone's business]]; to not [[involve]] one
#: {{zh-x|關.我.屌事，我 出來 '''打.醬油''' 的。|What's it got to do with me? I'm here to '''"buy soy sauce"'''.}}

====Usage notes====
* Usually used to express one's reluctance to discuss sensitive issues, sometimes in a jocular or sarcastic fashion.
